entry.title: Lyceum Theatre (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Lyceum Theatre (pictured) is New York City's oldest continuously operating legitimate theater?

entry.title: Borocera cajani (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Borocera cajani produces a form of wild silk that has been harvested for hundreds of years?

entry.title: Robert Campbell (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that after failing to establish a colony for black Americans at Abeokuta, Robert Campbell founded the first newspaper in Lagos?

entry.title: Central Asian Orogenic Belt (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Central Asian Orogenic Belt is a leading laboratory of geologically recent crustal growth?

entry.title: Atari 410 Program Recorder (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Atari 410 Program Recorder was used to store programs on the Atari 8-bit family, but was also used for computer aided instruction?

entry.title: Jonas Rose (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that after Jonas Rose wrecked a second ship, he never worked again?

entry.title: casatiello (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the ring shape of the casatiello represents Christ's crown of thorns?

entry.title: James van Riemsdyk (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that James van Riemsdyk once scored a goal for the Philadelphia Flyers on a puck that bounced off of his face and into the net?
